There are environment variables you can use to control the Java Virtual Machine that runs :
JAVA_HOME Normally it is used by the java executable that is found in the PATH environment variable. By using this variable, you can specify a different Java Virtual Machine installation directory.
JAVA_ARG_LINE You can specify a set of arguments for the Java Virtual Machine. The following example specifies the maximum and initial memory setting to be 300MB:SET JAVA_ARG_LINE=-Xmx300m -Xms300mSetting this environment variable disables the usage of the -Xmx parameter.
